Event.0:
Julius Caesar assassinated on the Ides of March
In 44  Roman dictator Julius Caesar was launching a series of political and social reforms when he was assassinated this day, the Ides of March, by a group of nobles, among whom were Cassius and Brutus.
Event.1: BC Julius Caesar is stabbed to death by Brutus, Cassius and several other Roman senators on the Ides of March in Rome
Event.2: Liu Bei, a Chinese warlord and member of the Han royal house, declares himself Emperor of Shu-Han, claiming legitimate succession to the Han Dynasty
Event.3: "Today" show anchor Savannah Guthrie (42) weds public relations Michael Feldman (45) at the Ritz Carlton Dove Mountain Resort in Tucson, Arizona
Event.4: Stand-up comedian and writer Sacha Baron Cohen (40) weds actress Isla Fisher (36) in Paris, France
Event.5: Hu Jintao succeeded Jiang Zemin as the president of China.
Event.6: The Congress of People's Deputies of the U.S.S.R. elected Mikhail Gorbachev to the newly created post of president of the Soviet Union.
Event.7: "The Godfather", based on the book by Mario Puzo, directed by Francis Ford Coppola and starring Marlon Brando and Al Pacino, premieres in NYC (Academy Awards Best Picture 1973)
Event.8: The Godfather, an epic drama about organized crime, premiered to universal acclaim; the Academy Award-winning film was directed by Francis Ford Coppola and starred Al Pacino and Marlon Brando.
Event.9: Following a highly publicized affair, American actress Elizabeth Taylor wed British actor Richard Burton in Montreal; they divorced in 1974 and briefly remarried (1975–76).
Event.10: Actress Elizabeth Taylor (32) marries for the 5th time to actor Richard Burton (38)
Event.11: Five research groups announce the discovery of anti-matter
Event.12:
Ry Cooder
American musician
was born
Event.13: Billboard publishes its 1st album chart (King Cole Trio is #1)
Event.14:
David Cronenberg
Canadian film director, screenwriter, and actor
was born
Event.15: Nicholas II, the last Russian Tsar abdicates and nominates his brother Grand Duke Michael to succeed him [OS Mar 2]
Event.16: During the first phase of the Russian Revolution, Tsar Nicholas II was forced to abdicate, thus ending the rule of the Romanov dynasty.
Event.17:
Reza Shah Pahlavi
shah of Iran
was born
Event.18: Pope Pius IX appointed John McCloskey the first American cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church.
Event.19: Cincinnati Red Stockings become the 1st professional baseball team
Event.20:
John Snow
British physician
was born
Event.21: In an emotional speech in Newburgh, New York, George Washington asks his officers not to support the Newburgh Conspiracy. The plea is successful and the threatened coup d'etat never takes place.
Event.22: American revolutionaries won a strategic victory over the British at the Battle of Guilford Courthouse in North Carolina.
Event.23: Military hero and seventh U.S. president (1829–37) Andrew Jackson, who was the first president to come from west of the Appalachians and the first to gain office by a direct appeal to the mass of voters, was born.
Event.24:
Andrew Jackson
president of United States
was born
Event.25: Franciscus Sylvius, whose studies helped shift medical emphasis from mystical speculation to a rational application of the laws of physics, was born in Hanau, Germany.
Event.26: Christopher Columbus returns to Spain after his first voyage to the New World
